sn2.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn2.1:4.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful god Kassapa, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
sn2.1:4.6: “The Buddha has revealed the mendicant, but not his instructions to a mendicant.”
sn2.1:4.7: “Well then, Kassapa, clarify this matter yourself.”
sn2.1:5.1: “They should train in following good advice,
sn2.1:5.3: in sitting alone in hidden places,
sn2.1:6.1: That’s what the god Kassapa said,
sn2.1:6.3: Then Kassapa, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
